title: 1200 sq ft Updated Rowhome
description:
........ AVAILABLE FOR RENT IN 19124 ON A ONE YEAR LEASE TERM.......
RESIDENCE DETAILS
3 Bedroom/1 Bath recently remodeled rowhome in the Frankford section of the city. 2 story plus full basement. 1200 sq ft. Full renovation inside completed mid-2021. (New electrical & service, new plumbing, new HVAC, new windows, new doors, new floors, new cabinets, new countertops, new sheetrock, new paint, new trim, new utility appliances (Furnace & Water Heater)). One previous year long lease so only the second tenancy since remodel.
Full & fully finished basement with newly added huge 200 sq. ft. 3rd bedroom; clothes closet; laundry closet; utility closets; & additional large open space suitable for 2nd living room, chill spot, movie room,  man cave, kids playroom, extra storage, or to make entire basement an expansive master bedroom suite (minus the bathroom). This space by itself rents the house IMO.
Hardwood floors throughout, 12"x24" tile in kitchen, bath, & basement. Granite countertops. High-end fixtures. Recessed lighting. Spacious closets. Stainless refrigerator & electric range provided. W/D Hookups in basement. Central heat & A/C.
Fenced in large backyard with grass, shade, & with a new cement path to the back alley that leads to cross street for easy rear entrance to home. Outdoor water & electrical acccess. New siding & stucco. Street parking. Good neighborhood. Friendly neighbors. Convenient location (74/100 on Zillow).
NEIGHBORHOOD
Conveniently located near popular MFL station as well as 3, 5, & 56 bus routes and a short drive to I-95 on ramp. Commuting to Center City for work on SEPTA will take you about 30 minutes. Laundromat within 5 minute walk. Family Dollar, Aldi, Rite Aid, Save-A-Lot, Dollar General, Shoprite, Wawa, McDonalds, Dunkin' Donuts, Popeyes, and Texas Chicken & Burgers all within 1.2 miles or less. Walmart & Target as well as a multitude of other big name stores & restaurants are accessible by car in 5 minutes or by bus in 15. Local parks & playgrounds walkable or by very short bus ride. Allen M. Stearne (K-8) & Frankford High (9-12) Schools.
LEASE & DEPOSIT
One year lease term with subsequent auto-renewing month-to-month lease extension. $1050 per month (RentZestimate® is $1099).  A security deposit equivalent of TWO months rent, plus FIRST & LAST month rent, for a total of $4200 is due at the time of the signing of the lease (plus any applicable pet deposit)
PAYMENT METHODS
*NOTE: Deposit may be made in cash, or by EFT (Ca$happ, Zelle, Venmo, Paypal), ONLY. I feel as though EFT is best because it can go directly to into my escrow account as required by law, and that means you will immediately & exactly know where your deposit is being held. Nobody argues with cash, however, including me. Cash will always be king. No checks. No 3rd party payments. I have my reasons for doing this . The main one is to avoid being scammed (again & again) by bounced check into letting a squatter with no intention to pay gain entry to my house (its happened before), plus checks are so dated, slow, & easily forged or badly written to manipulate time frames to the max and can really jam up business. I despsie checks; another reason is to establish that you are independent & reliable and capable of making timely monthly rent payments on your own. Its very aggravating to have to repeat this whole process in 3 months because mom paid your deposit and you couldnt afford to keep making rent and I have to go through Eviction Diversion. So likewise, no co-signator to the lease. After deposit is paid, we can discuss paying by check if that is how you prefer to pay your monthly rent. If this is an issue for you, no hard feelings & i'm sure there are plenty of other places currently for rent in Philly, as I'm sure there are plenty of other prospective tenants besides you*
UTILITIES
Tenant is responsible for paying all utilites including PWD (water), PECO (electric), & PGW (gas). Trash & recycling colllection is provided free of charge by the Dept. Of Streets. One blue recycing bin is provided for your use. Trash cans are the responsibility of the tenant.
Water Heater, Range, & Furnace Ignition Switch/Blower are all electric. Furnace Fuel Source is Natural Gas.
ADDITIONAL TERMS
Up to 2 pets allowed, $50 pet deposit per.
Smoking is permitted on the premesis but please be responsible & courteous about the butts.
Rent is due on the 3rd of each month, with a grace period until the 13th because, well,  shit happens. Late rent payments in excess of 10 days, and insufficient funds returns, subject to additional fee.
No Section 8 or vouchers are accepted.
Lost keys are subject to $50 replacement fee. Lockout services are $125 per occurrence.
APPLICANTS
The ideal applicant will have a credit score at 600 or above, favorable references, gainful employment, and satisfactory credit & rental history, free of any judgements or evictions. All applicants are considered equally,fairly, & without discrimination or immmediate disqualifcation for any one derogatory mark,  regardless of their past, race, religion, age, sexual orientationz and I encourage people from all backgrounds, heritages, & walks of life to apply.
APPLICATION PROCESS
Nevertheless, a routine personal background check is still required, as is the associated non-refundable $30 application fee, payable by EFT. No walk-throughs will be scheduled before application & fee have been collected as to not waste anybodys time. It is a very busy time of the year and as limited as my time is already with twins expected any time between now & Christmas, I also live in Trappe - 45 minute trip each way with no traffic - and work in Boyertown - 56 min trip each way with no traffic - so getting down here to show the places I have for rent is time consuming and very tricky.
So unfortunately if you arent qualified, there is no sense in you seeing it or me having to drive down to show it to you. I don't mean to be rude, its just being practical & honest. I do, however, try to work with everyone, but in order to get past sub-600 credit scores and past evictions, at a minimum, your monthly net income must be at least 3x the rent ($750/week) and have at least one recent glowing reference in regards to making payments in full & on-time. I also do not perform criminal background checks on my applicants. Everyone  deserves a second chance, including felons, and your crime is not my business, not my place to judge you, and not relevant to whether or not you are a good tenant. Your rental - not your criminal - history tells me that.
MOVE-IN DATE
Reply to this ad to start the process by submitting your application and fee. Won't last long!!! Move-in date is set for 01 January 2023 but I can probably push it to 15 December 2022 (if no water breaks, if no mandatory OT, if no this no that......) but move-in costs would then jump, as pro-rated December rent would need to be paid up front as well. NO HOLDS! Payment of Security Deposit ONLY is required, and the ONLY way, to secure the rental til 01 January. First & Last can be made in advance all at once or when you get the keys.
INFORMALITIES
I'm sorry I can't accomodate everyone. Telling people I chose another applicant is the worst part of my role as landlord. Any questions, I am happy to oblige!! A safe & happy holiday season to you all. Thank you!

title: Enjoy the private pool in the communal courtyard for Strickland court
description: The rarely available Strickland Court condominiums are a bright one-bedroom unit with a courtyard and pool in the middle of Washington Square West. As soon as you step inside this converted brownstone, you'll notice how much of its original character and history come from old Philadelphia. When you first walk into the apartment, you'll be struck by how open the space is and how much natural light floods in through the large windows and high ceilings. This area leads to a sizable kitchen with a deep pantry and lots of counter space. Along the hallway, there is a full bathroom as well as a storage closet with a washer and dryer built in. The main bedroom has two large windows that look out onto the courtyard and two closets with additional space above for additional storage. Enjoy the private pool in the communal courtyard for Strickland court residents only. With easy access to Jefferson Hospital, public transportation, and a wide variety of eateries, including Middle Child, Kanella, GreenStreet Coffee Roasters, Varga, Tria, and Bleu Sushi, to name a few, this home's location is unbeatable. Make an appointment right away
